Content: Teacher asked me to take off salwar after allegations of stealing money. BHOPAL: In a shameful incident in a government school of Damoh, a dalit school girl was made to undress after a student levelled allegations of stealing Rs 70 on November 2. However, the incident came to light when the education department set up a committee of principals on Saturday to look into the allegations after the parents protested for alleged disrobing of their daughter.The district education officer (DEO) PP Singh admitted the incident and said an inquiry has been ordered and action will be initiated against the teacher, Jyoti Gupta ,if she is found involved in the incident.The agitating parents also reached school to protest against the alleged disrobing of their daughter .On Thursday night, a class 10 student of Rani Durgawati government girls high school of Damoh, told her parents that her class teacher asked her to take off her salwar to check whether she had stolen an amount of Rs 70. The student said that another student had lost the money and alleged that she had stolen it.‚ÄúFirst the teacher frisked her and later she asked me to take off my salwar‚Äù, she told her parents. The teacher also threatened me to call a tantric (sorcerer) to find out the truth, she added.The minor girl was so upset that she did not take dinner that night, her father said.Her father, a labourer, was angry and so was her mother. They decided to meet the school administration on the next day.On Friday, when they met the principal Rita Asati , she denied any such incident.On Saturday girl told local media, ‚ÄúAfter a student said she had lost Rs 70/-, the teacher checked the school bags. She also said she would call a sorcerer to find out the truth. I said Ok call him, If I have stolen the money, he would get it. Later she asked me to take off my salwar.‚ÄùIn fact, she said, two girls were asked to undress in front of the students.Girl‚Äôs parents did not file any police complaint.The DEO told TOI, ‚ÄúI have sought explanation from the principal. A team of women principals of government schools of Damoh will hold inquiry from Monday.‚Äù

Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee meet, GST and demonetisation on¬†table. Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday held an hour-long meeting with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and the BJP governments economic policies such as GST and demonetisation are believed to have come up.The development is being seen as a meeting of regional parties to form a pressure group against the BJP before the 2019 general elections.Thackeray said his meeting was a courtesy call. There are areas of common concern on policy issues. We were the first ones to voice our protest against the GST and demonetisation. So has Trinamool Congress expressed concerns over these issues, he said, adding that meeting should not be perceived as political ploy against the BJP.We also discussed on taking ahead the proposal for Kolkata and Mumbai municipal corporations on the concept of sister cities, he said.A close aide of Mamata said: The discussions veered around the Modi governments economic policies, which have generated unrest among people. The aide mentioned GST, demonetisation as the issues that were discussed.During the meeting, Thackeray reportedly highlighted his partys protests against the BJP government in Maharashtra. The aide said Mamata was the first leader in the country to protest against economic reforms of the Centre by tweeting against demonetisation and GST. The Shiv Sena and TMC, despite huge ideological differences, have resumed a dialogue as they perceive the BJP to be their main political rival in the 2019 elections, a source in Bengal said.The TMC is alarmed at the BJPs attempts to make inroads in West Bengal. The resignation of Trinamool Congress (MP) Mukul Roy is perceived as a handiwork of the BJP, a political observer said. In Maharashtra, on the other hand, the Sena fears that the BJP, by allowing Narayan Ranes Maharashtra Swabhimani Party to join the NDA, has compounded their problems in Konkan region.A source in Trinamool said, In politics, the enemys enemy is a friend. Sena and Trinamool talks should be perceived in that context. Mamata is emerging as the leader of the regional forces who are not very happy with the BJP.However, Trinamool leaders also have concerns about the Sena. A second-rung leader said,  You cannot fight a battle against the BJP when you are enjoying power with them in Centre (NDA) and Maharashtra. Trinamool Congress will have to face uncomfortable questions. Second, the Senas anti-minorities politics,. specially their drive against Bangladeshis, also has Trinamool leaders worried.A senior Trinamool functionary said: In West Bengal, we have a sizeable minority population, which will never not accept the Sena style of politics.However, a Sena leader said, Sena and Trinamool are not working to strike an electoral alliance. Sena has no base in Bengal nor Trinamool in Maharashtra. Their bonding is confined to anti-Modi policies and politics.

Hindu Yuva Vahini activists protest against RaGa RSS remarks on women. SURAT: Hindu Yuva Vahini members made posters of Congress president Sonia Gandhi and vice president Rahul Gandhi \ which showed them in shorts\ and also staged a protest in Udhna area of the city on Thursday evening. They sent these posters to Rahul address in New Delhi. They were protesting against Rahul comment on women in RSS. Hindu Yuva Vahini state unit president Narendra Chaudhary said, \We want to open the eyes of Rahul. Why is he so keen to see women in shorts? We have sent him some posters by couriers so that he can have a good look at them. Hindu Yuva Vahini was founded by Yogi Adityanath, who is now the chief minister of Uttar Pradesh. Yogi Adityanath is expected to visit Valsad, Navsari and Surat districts on Friday. He would be addressing a public meeting at Sachin in Surat district.

RSS leader Ravinder Gosain shot dead in Ludhiana. LUDHIANA: A Ludhiana-based RSS leader Ravinder Gosain (60) was shot dead outside his house in Gagandeep Colony of Jodhewal area on Tuesday morning. The leader was pumped two bullets by motorcycle borne two masked assailants, in head and back and he died on spot.The deceased was the head of Mohan Shikha located in Amantran colony of Jodhewal. On Tuesday Gosain returned from Shakha around 7am and was sitting outside his house with two grandchildren when he was gunned down.The CCTV installed near the location has captured the assailants roaming around the area since 6:30am. They have also been captured fleeing after the incident in another CCTV. The assailants were on Honda Stunner bike of black-yellow color.Bike borne miscreants captured in CCTV.Gosain was associated with RSS since childhood and was an active member of Shakha.The zonal General Secretary RSS, Yash Giri said, "This is the failure of police administration as earlier also the police have been failed to cracker previous cases of attacks on religious leaders."He added, "I have received a call from the Finance minister Arun Jaitley and he asked about the incident. All senior leaders are in touch with us."The district president of BJP, Ravinder Arora said, "To agitate against the failure of police the RSS and BJP leaders will protest outside the office of Commissioner of police, after cremation."The Commissioner of police, RN Dhoke said, "The police are exploring all angles in the case."The Ludhiana police have also released the pictures of suspects, captured in CCTVs, on social media with contact numbers.The kin of deceased are clueless about the reason behind the killing as according to them Ravinder Gosain had never received any threat.

Govt blinks but Asha workers to continue stir Vadodara: Gujarat government announcement of increasing salaries of Asha (Accredited Social Health Activist) workers by 50% on Tuesday came after over a month-long agitation launched by the health workers across the state. During the course of this agitation which included indefinite hunger strike, the agitated health workers have not only gheraoed BJP MLAs in Vadodara but also stormed BJP office in the city and allgedly threw bangles on Prime Minister Narendra Modi cavalcade when he was conducting a roadshow near VUDA circle in Vadodara on Sunday (October 22) evening.But the Contract and Fixed Salary Struggles Committee which has launched the state-wide agitation demanding equal pay and equal rights for Asha workers and facilitators has termed the state government announcement as merely a gimmick and an attempt to misguide and weaken their agitation in the poll-bound state. According to the committee office-bearers, there are currently 45,000 health workers in the state who are responsible for conducting all the health drives in the state. Each health worker on contract presently gets Rs 1,000 as salary every month. \We still dont know the exact amount which we will get after 50 % hike announced by the state government on Tuesday. But even if our salaries are hiked to Rs 2,000 per month, the health workers will continue to get only partial payments, said Chandrika Solanki, president of the women wing of the committee. \From Rs 1,000 per month, the government cuts Rs 200 if a Asha worker fails to attend \Mamta Divas\, Rs 150 if she does not meet medical officer, Rs 150 if she does not attend \gram sanjivani\ programme and Rs 100 if the Asha worker fails to share information with higher ups in the health department, she said. \We had demanded that all the health workers should get minimum Rs 5,000 to Rs 6,000 as fixed salary every month apart from incentives for conducting or taking part in health drives and surveys, she said.The committee has decided to continue its agitation to press for its demand including fixed maternity leaves, health insurance coverage and sick leaves, accidental insurance, fixed working hours and identity cards \ the benefits which are provided to permanent workers. \Our health workers are exposed to unhygienic working conditions and are expected to carry out malaria, swine flu and TB surveys. But there is no health protection that they themselves receive, she said. Ironically, while the state government announced that the salaries of Asha workers will be hiked, around 100 Asha workers in Vadodara were detained by the cops and kept in confinement at police community hall at Hazirabaug and crime branch office at Bhadra Kacheri while their mobile phones were also seized. While a group of around 50 health workers were detained by the cops on Tuesday morning when they sat outside collectorate office to continue their protest after they were not allowed to enter the collectorate. A group of another 50 health workers, who were protesting at Kothi crossroads by raising slogans against all BJP MLAs, MP, Gujarat chief minister Vijay Rupani and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, were detained on Tuesday afternoon. Vadodara district collector P Bharathi, however, said that she had only asked the agitators not to stage protests at the collectorate as it was obstructing work in the premises. \Last week, we also had a meeting with the chief district health officer and the officials of Vadodara Municipal Corporation. Since, it was a policy level decision, we had sent our report to the state government, she said.

Vadodara: Government employees on contract bring out rally VADODARA: Employees taken on contract for 11 months in various government departments held a rally in the city on Monday. They have been demanding an end to contractual employments and rights as well as emoluments equal to regular staffers.The employees taken on contract and daily wages have earlier submitted memorandums to the state government stating that they were being exploited. They have started an agitation under the banner \Fight for Right\.It was for the first time that the group brought out a rally in the city. The group has threatened to intensify the agitation if their demands are not met at the earliest. The group has also opposed the outsourcing of various tasks to agencies by the government.

DMK, allies close ranks against AIADMK CHENNAI: In a homecoming of sorts, erstwhile allies, including DMK, MDMK, CPI, VCK and IUML, came together on the same dais in RK Nagar on Monday. The venue was a narrow street with cadres and supporters vying for vantage position to grab the moment.With all the party leaders campaigning for DMK candidate Marudhu Ganesh, the common chord that they struck was the plight of missing fishermen lost in the sea off Kanyakumari in the wake of Cyclone Ockhi. They urged their brethren in RK Nagar to defeat ‚Äòineffective‚Äô AIADMK and pave the way for DMK working president M K Stalin to take charge as CM.Stalin, who spoke at the end of the meeting, said he had proof to show that an AIADMK MP was distributing tokens for the government‚Äôs subsidised scooter scheme which is to be launched shortly. ‚ÄúIf the election commission refuses to take action, DMK will go to the streets to protest,‚Äù Stalin said.He said the AIADMK‚Äôs two leaves symbol was no threat to DMK. ‚ÄúIn several elections, we have defeated the AIADMK. In the 2016 assembly elections, the AIADMK lost its deposit in some seats in Kanyakumari district. Thus we are not afraid of the symbol,‚Äù said Stalin.MDMK leader Vaiko, who recently extended an olive branch to Stalin, exhorted DMK cadres to campaign in all streets and bring home victory for their party. ‚ÄúIt is for the DMK cadres, who are second to none to make Ganesh the victor. The victory in RK Nagar will pave the way for Stalin to sit in the chief minister‚Äôs chair,‚Äù said Vaiko, recalling his long association with DMK chief M Karunanidhi.‚ÄúI never wanted to hurt any person or religion. There is a bid to link my speech with DMK‚Äôs prospects in RK Nagar. I make it clear that I am solely responsible for whatever I have said and DMK is no way connected to it,‚Äù said Thirumavalavan, referring to his December 6 speech on Lord Rama that raised BJP and some Hindu outfits‚Äô hackles.‚ÄúThere is no history of an inspector becoming a sub-inspector and that can happen only in Tamil Nadu and only in AIADMK,‚Äù said CPI state secretary R Mutharasan, referring to erstwhile AIADMK rebel leader O Pannerselvam taking charge as deputy CM.Though leaders were upbeat about a DMK victory in RK Nagar, cadres did not seem so confident.‚ÄúThe demands of voters are very high. We are not sure that we can match them,‚Äù said M Munusamy, a DMK veteran from Tiruvottiyur.

Switch off cell: Anti-Aadhaar stir launched PUNE: Activists from Pune as well as across India have urged citizens to switch off their phones from 11am to 11.30am till December 11 to protest the forced linking of Aadhaar number with various services.The protest, which started on November 11, has gathered steam Pune with many asserting their right to be forgotten by the Aadhaar database. Pune-based activist and international advisor on governance of complex systems Anupam Saraf said that the movement has been active in Pune with many citizens staging silent protest against Aaadhaar. ‚ÄúThis movement is basically to protest Aadhaar linkage and we are doing it for 30 days initially and then we will decide on the next course of action,‚Äô‚Äô stated Saraf. He believes that no one should be coerced into linking Aaadhaar number with various services and it is time that government does a rethink on the same.

Telangana: Adivasis demand exclusion of Lambadas from ST¬†list Adivasis in Telangana are agitating, demanding the exclusion of Lambadas from the Scheduled Tribes list and alleging that they were cornering 90 per cent of the reservation in jobs and education.In neighbouring Andhra Pradesh too, ST associations started a protest Sunday against the TDP governments decision to include the Valmiki and Boya communities in the ST list.In April this year, the K Chandrashekar Rao government in Telangana introduced a Bill to increase the quota for STs from 6 per cent to 12 per cent. While the legislation has been passed by the Assembly, its implementation will require the Centres nod for its inclusion in Ninth Schedule of the Constitution.ST leaders are, however, saying that the communities wont benefit by the increase in quota unless Lambadas are excluded from the ST category.Adivasis, mainly from Adilabad and Kumaram Bheem Asifabad districts, held a large protest meeting at Saroornagar Stadium in Hyderabad on Saturday. This is the first time ST associations such as the Telangana Tudum Debba and Adivasi Association, Girijana Aikhya Vedika, Adivasi Hakkula Poratha Samiti, Adivasi Students Assocation and others came together to protest.STs comprise 9.3 per cent of Telanganas population, numbering about 31 lakh. Over a lakh members from Gond, Koya, Pardhan, Kollam, Naikpodu and Thoti tribes of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh took part in the protest on Saturday.The meeting was attended by several ruling TRS leaders from the ST community, who alleged that the majority of Lambadas in Telangana were migrants from Maharashtra and Karnataka, but were taking away a chunk of reservations in the ST category meant for local residents. There is anger in Adivasi communities over Lambadas, whom they dont consider as local residents. Tribals from remote areas are unable to compete with Lambadas who settle down in urban and semi-urban areas and take up jobs, Adilabad MP G Nagesh said.ST leaders alleged that a well-oiled racket in the village and mandal-level administration is helping Lambadas get domicile and local tribe certificates.Lambadas who have settled in Telangana in recent years are also eligible for ST quota. This is unfair. They come from outside Telangana, but are getting 90 per cent of the existing 6 per cent quota in jobs or education, said Kumaram Soni Rao, grandson of tribal freedom fighter Kumaram Bheem and an ST leader.The tension between tribals and Lambadas is simmering in predominantly tribal areas of Adilabad, Asifabad, Karimnagar and Warangal.Samaiah Dora, Girijana Aikhya Vedidas general secretary, accused Lambadas of cornering various government schemes. Originally there were 32 STs in Telangana and Andhra but the Lambadas were added to the list in 1976. We will take our demand to Delhi soon.

Trader killed, 2 other suffered bullet injuries in loot bid in Jaunpur VARANASI: A trader was killed while two other persons suffered bullet injuries when two motorcycle borne miscreants opened fire on them in a loot bid in the market of Mungardeeh village under Mungra Badshahpur area of Jaunpur district on Monday afternoon.Brave locals caught the shooters after giving chase and beat them brutally before setting their motorcycle ablaze. Police had to exercise hard to rescue the shooters from the angry mob of locals.According to reports, an insurance agent Sandeep Mishra of Jaipalpur runs his office for premium collection at Mungardeeh market. On Monday afternoon he was collecting premium from one Rakesh Maurya of Bhasot village the motorcycle borne miscreants raided the place and tried to loot the cash from Shukla. When Shukla and Maurya opposed their bid the miscreants opened indiscriminate fire on them. On seeing it a local trader Vinay Tiwari (30) tried to catch the shooters when they opened indiscriminate fire on him. On suffering bullet injuries on chest Tiwari died on the spot.The sound of firing led to chaos in the market. But, within few seconds the traders and local natives came on road and caught the shooters after chasing them up to some distance. The angry mob of local thrashed the miscreants and also set their motorcycle on fire. On getting information SO Mungra Badshahpur reached there with heavy police force. However, police had to exercise hard to rescue the shooters from the locals.Later, Shukla and Maurya were rushed to local hospital where the doctors referred them to Allahabad. Police took the injured shooters to district hospital. The SP Jaunpur KK Chawdhary said that police were trying to identify the miscreants also their criminal history. The body of Tiwari was sent for postmortem.

Non-teaching staff of MSU to go on hunger strike. VADODARA: A non-teaching staff union of M S University has threatened to stage hunger strike at the university campus on Monday. The Gujarat Rajya Pachhatwarg-Baxipunch Karmachari Mandal has said that temporary staffers will sit on a hunger strike protest at the university campus to press for their long pending demands. ‚ÄúWe have time and again made representations before MSU vice-chancellor Parimal Vyas and in-charge registrar Dr Neerja Jaiswal to resolve the long pending demands of temporary staffers. But neither the state government nor the university authorities have resolved our problems. Hence, we have decided to go on hunger strike,‚Äù said mandal‚Äôs president Thakore Solanki. He added that several representations have been made in the past to make temporary staffers permanent in the university system. ‚ÄúThere are 600 staffers who are suffering because the issue has not been resolved,‚Äù he said.

Jallikattu ban: Police lathicharge, detain 30 protestors in Madurai NEW DELHI: At least 30 supporters of Jallikattu were on Saturday taken into preventive custody in Tamil Nadu's Madurai district for allegedly trying to defy a ban on the controversial bull-taming sport played during Pongal festival.According to the ANI report, the state police first lathicharged protestors who have been agitating against the ban in the Madurai's Avaniapuram area.Heavy police force was deployed since yesterday in Avaniapuram, Palamedu and Alanganallur, famous locations for jallikattu in Madurai District, as various organisations vowed to violate the ban and organise the sport. Tamil Nadu: Police lathi charge protesters in Avanivapuram(Madurai). 30 people detained  #jallikattupic.twitter.com/wtPgXNM1NM‚Äî ANI (@ANI_news)  January 14, 2017On Thursday, the Supreme Court had said it could not give its verdict on Jallikattu before Pongal even as political parties cutting across party lines had demanded from the Centre promulgation of an ordinance to allow the sport.Yesterday, in Karisalkulam village near Madurai, the sport was held in an open ground for a few minutes.In a symbolic protest, around five bulls were let into the ground by a group of youths, police had said, adding no arrests were made.DMK Working President M K Stalin had led a protest in Chennai yesterday in this regard as he targeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly not giving time for AIADMK MPs to discuss the Jallikattu issue.On Friday, some Jallikattu supporters briefly picketed locale of the shooting of Tamil film "Garjanai", starring Trisha, in Sivaganga district, angered by the actor's pro-PETA stand.However, Trisha, a known animal lover who has featured in PETA's advertisement for adopting homeless dogs, was not present there at that time.Police said all preventive steps have been taken to ensure maintenance of law and order and compliance of court's ban.

Punjab farmers to protest outside Parliament on March 30 PUNJAB FARMERS, under the banner of Bharti Kissan Union Ekta (Dakaunda), Azaad Kissan Sangharsh Committee and Krantikari Kissan Union, Punjab, will hold a protest march outside Parliament in New Delhi on March 30 to expose the anti-farmer policies of the Union government. They said a large number of womenfolk would also take part.The farmers organisations have been demanding that all kinds of moneylenders, commission agents, cooperative and bank loans and debts should be waived and the Swaminathan Committee report should be implemented in toto for suitable remuneration of all crops. Crops like Basmati rice, potatoes, vegetables and fruits should also be included in the Price Commissions purview for fixing of rates and the government should ensure their procurement through state agencies.This protest would draw the attention of all strata of masses, while Parliament is in progress and the farmers unions would not allow police to prevent them from holding protest.BKU Ekta (Dakaunda) state president Buta Singh Burjgill, state general secretary Jagmohan Singh Patiala and senior vice-president Manjeet Singh Dhaner have confirmed that they have organised meetings and rallies at most of the villages in Patiala, Barnala, Sangrur, Bathinda, Fatehgarh Sahib, Faridkot, Ludhiana and Ferozepur and the cotton belt of Malwa.The farmers are disappointed over the import of those grain that the country already has sufficient stocks of and will force the government to shun the import of those commodities, where the scope of bumper production lies in India, said Jagmohan.

GNIDA collects details from Czar project; to submit in court on February 8 GREATER NOIDA: A day after Allahabad high court stayed the allotment of flats in Supertech Czar Suites project in Greater Noida, the Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) mobilized teams of officials to gather details of the project. GNIDA officials on Thursday visited the project to obtain measurements of the actual land area used for the project. Allahabad high court has asked GNIDA to furnish details of the housing project on February 8 hearing.According to GNIDA officials, measures for setback area, parking spaces, built-up area and residential unit size in the society located in Omicron-I was also taken. "I have asked my officials from the architect and planning department to collect all information," said Deepak Agarwal, chief executive officer (CEO), GNIDA. "I have also directed officials to collect physical details of number of units the builder has built on the project. How many were sanctioned and allowed by GNIDA. How many have been constructed without permission, their area and numbers will also be recorded," he said. "If we find any discrepancies in the allowed units and those constructed, we will take the appropriate action," he added.Agarwal further told TOI that they had not yet received the AHC order in the case. "We are awaiting the official court order copy. Once we receive it, we will comply with the court‚Äôs directions. Our action taken report along with our detailed findings about the project will be filed in our reply during the next court hearing, which is on February 8, 2017," he explained. The court had on Wednesday directed GNIDA not to issue completion certificates for the project and take appropriate action in accordance with the law against the builder. It also directed GNIDA to ensure one of its officers was present in court during the next hearing to assist the judges with facts of the case.Czar is located in Sector Omicron 1 of Greater Noida and built across 20 acres that Supertech group was allotted in 2006. Around 450 families live in the society. Home buyers in the project had approached the judiciary when they did not get reprieve from GNIDA regarding their protest that the builder had built over 1,000 residential units in violation of sanctioned building plans.

Students at IIT B support agitation against Jallikattu ban  A group of students of the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, have extended their support to protests in Tamil Nadu against the ban on Jallikattu, a sport in which bulls participate.Three days after the youth gathered at Chennais Marina beach in support of Jallikattu, around 50 IIT B students came together Thursday to hold a silent protest within campus to show their support.They circulated pamphlets which claimed that Jallikattu was a sport in Tamil Nadu that had been misconceptualised as bull taming.

Punjab AAP MLA burns crops as Kejriwal rues pollution efforts  NEW DELHI: While Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is concerned about the severe air pollution in the capital, an AAP MLA from Punjab was caught burning crops.Sukhpal Khaira is the leader of the opposition in Punjab Assembly and apparently he burnt the crops to support the farmers in the region.According to Times Now, Sukhpal Khaira started a protest in Samrala, Ludhiana on October 15 and burnt paddy stubble to protest against government s decision to book farmers for burning crops.The protest was against the Congress government in Punjab, which issued guidelines to file FIRs against the farmersa who engage in crop burning.Khaira said the Punjab government should provide tools and machinery on rent to dispose of the stubble.The whole incident came as a shock as AAP government is trying to control the hazardous air pollution in Delhi.

Uttar Pradesh BJP manifesto bundle of lies: SP, BSP, Congress  TERMING BJPs election manifesto a ploy to fool people, BSP chief Mayawati said on Saturday that the BJP government at the Centre has not fulfilled even one fourth of the promises it had made in the run up to the 2014 Lok Sabha polls.

14 people burst crackers outside SC, detained. "Fourteen people, including three women, were detained for bursting firecrackers outside the Supreme Court to protest the temporary ban on the sale of firecrackers. They were taken to Tilak Marg police station, from where they were released within 30 minutes.DCP (New Delhi district) B K Singh said they received a call at around 4.45 pm that some people were protesting outside D gate of the Supreme Court and bursting crackers. After receiving the PCR call, police immediately rushed to the spot and detained the protesters. The members, who claimed to be from an outfit named Azad Hind Fauj, burst firecrackers outside the apex court. As many as 14 persons, including three women, were detained under Sections 65 Delhi Police Act and taken to Tilak Marg police station, he added.After questioning, police came to know that the demonstrators were led by one Satpal Malhotra (55), who came from northwest Delhis Gagan Vihar area in their cars and were protesting against the Supreme Courts order.Two arrested in Gurgaon for selling crackersTwo persons were arrested Tuesday and a shop was sealed for selling firecrackers in Gurgaon. Police said the two men arrested have been identified as Guddu and Sonu, both residents of Uttar Pradesh and were selling crackers in Sector 9A. Information was received that the two were selling crackers by the roadside. They were arrested from the spot, said Ravinder Kumar, RO, Gurgaon Police.A few hours later, a shop in Gadoli village was sealed and 39 boxes of crackers were seized, Kumar added.

Pakistan protests press government over disappearance of activists  Human rights activists in Pakistan on Tuesday rallied to protest the disappearance of four activists over the past one week and asked the government to take measures to locate them.Leftist liberals accuse that security agencies or militants might be behind the forced disappearances though nobody has claimed responsibility for the abduction. Protest rallies were held in Islamabad, Karachi and Lahore, where journalists, civil society supporters and rights activists demanded urgent measures to find the four missing activists.The missing activist include Salman Haider, a poet and university professor, who disappeared on Friday here.

Rahul Gandhi-Akhilesh Yadav road show in Varanasi on March 4 VARANASI: The joint road show of UP chief minister and SP president Akhilesh Yadav and Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will be held in the parliamentary constituency of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on March 4. The road show, earlier scheduled for February 11, was postponed to February 27 and then cancelled.According to the CM‚Äôs itinerary available with the district administration, he will take part in the road show in Varanasi on March 4. Before attending the road show, he will address election meetings at Keshavpur in Bhadohi district and Munari in Varanasi district in favour of SP candidates contesting from Bhadohi, Aurai, Gyanpur, Ajagra and Shivpur constituencies in the two districts. After the public meetings, he will move to Varanasi police lines to take part in the road show.UPCC spokesperson Satish Rai said the preparations are on for the road show which will cover a distance of 15km from Police Lines to Lanka. About three dozen welcome booths will be made at different places on the entire route. Rahul will arriving in the city on March 2 to address a public meeting at Pindra Bazar in favour of Congress candidate from Pindra Assembly constituency Ajay Rai. According to Rahul‚Äôs official schedule, he will also address public meetings at Maharajganj and Gorakhpur on the same day.

Nature lovers ‚Äòmourn‚Äô banyan deaths Vadodara: On Sunday morning, a group of citizens gathered at Yavteshwar Temple compound on the Jail Road for a condolence meet. But it was not for some person known to them. The group was rather mourning chopping down of decades-old banyan trees, which has given Vadodara its name and a distinct identity. A huge banyan tree located in Maharani Shantadevi compound owned by the royal Gaekwad family was chopped a couple of weeks ago to make way for a proposed shopping mall. Another grand banyan tree located opposite the railway station was pulled down as the civic body is planning to build an integrated transport terminal there. ‚ÄúWe are not against any development projects. But there has to be a balance. Maintaining greenery and conserving environment in the city should also be a part of Smart City project. The two trees that were chopped were a part of our bio-diversity for decades,‚Äù said Milind Gadre, member of the Nature Walk group that had organized the event. The two banyan trees were a home of large number of bird and insect species too and the nature lovers had tried their level best to see that they are not chopped.‚ÄúWe tried hard to save them from being chopped by writing to all the authorities including the Prime Minister Office (PMO). However, everything was in vain,‚Äù Gadre told TOI. The Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) had earlier promised to transplant the old trees that had to be cut for development projects. ‚ÄúOne of these chopped banyan trees has been replanted by VMC in Sama but it not being watered regularly,‚Äù said Arun Majmudar, another member of the group, who visited the spot. Members of the group offered flowers to the photographs of these trees and observed two minutes of silence. Later saplings of banyan and peepul tree were planted in the Yavteshwar Temple compound by the members. ‚ÄúDevelopment can happen without chopping such old trees that are like the lungs of our city. Times View:Taking up new development projects as a part of the Smart City initiative is essential but this shouldn‚Äôt be done at the cost of city‚Äôs green cover. Vadodara essentially derived its name from ‚ÄòVad‚Äô (banyan) but these trees are fast disappearing from the city‚Äôs landscape. UP CM Mauritius-bound after rolling out red carpet to US firms Lucknow, Oct 29 () After rolling out the red carpet to American companies interested to invest in Uttar Pradesh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is set to travel to Mauritius this week to invite NRIs to the state. Adityatnath is also likely to invite people of Indian origin to participate in the NRI Diwas to he held in Lucknow in March next year. During his stay in Mauritius, the chief minister will meet NRIs and explore possibilities for investment in Uttar Pradesh, the official said. He will also apprise them of the steps taken by his government to facilitate investors in the state and the measures taken in this regard. Adityanath recently met representatives of more than two dozen US companies exploring investment opportunities in the state. The "US in UP" engagement emulated the "Vibrant Gujarat" model and showcased the state's investment avenues in chemicals, petrochemicals, pharmaceuticals, cement, gems, textiles and engineering sectors. The government expects the joint event to attract investment from both the NRIs as well as the business leaders. A date for the events will be announced soon, the sources added. SMI ABH

Govt mulls flexible NH toll plan to commuters benefit NEW DELHI: The government is considering offering a "rolling contract" for road development that will see toll collection end ahead of the contracted period if the investment and profit has been recovered, in order to blunt criticism that surfaced over Delhi-Noida-Direct (DND) flyway and Delhi-Gurgaon projects. Conversely, the contract period may be extended if the contractor, due to certain circumstances, is unable to recover expected dues. Though the proposal offers some succour to contractors, NHAI will reserve the right to take over the project to stem public opposition over "super profits". The ministry had a detailed discussion on this model-variable build operate and transfer (V-BOT)-on Saturday. Cases like that of DND and other highway projects where contractors are a llowed to collect toll for years have prompted the government to explore this new public-private partnership (PPP) model for road construction.  There have been several instances of protests in states including Delhi, UP and Maharashtra against the existing practice. Even a parliamentary committee had pointed out this flaw while examining the contract period and total toll collection on the Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway.  "The real-time toll collection in each project rolled out under V-BOT will be verified using the electronic toll collection data and other IT-enabled assessments, the parametes of which will be defined clearly," said a ministry official. Under this model, the projects will be bid out on the basis of total cost (including construction, financing, operation and maintenance) for a defined contract period. The lowest bidder will get the project and will build, operate and collect toll.  "If toll collection increases beyond the projection due to high traffic growth, the contractor will recover the cost before the quoted period and NHAI will terminate the contract. NHAI will then collect toll to recover the land cost. When that amount is recovered, toll will be slashed by 40%," another official said. All such projects will compulsorily have 100% electronic toll collection, installation of automatic traffic count and classifier system, video image detection and other systems.  The model has been conceptualised to address all the risk factors, another official said.

Leuva Patels stake claim to world record in singing national anthem KAGVAD (RAJKOT): Leuva Patels who congregated at Khodaldham temple in Kagvad village of Rajkot on Saturday staked claim to entering the Guinness World Records for the highest number of people singing a national anthem simultaneously at a single venue. Aasu forms human chain to protest Brahmaputra contamination GUWAHATI: More than 300 students from various academic institutions in the city came together to form a human chain at Uzanbazar Ghat in protest against the government's "inaction" on the contamination of the Brahmaputra. Bengaluru: Hundreds march on Borewell Road against government s apathy  BENGALURU: More than 200 residents of BBMP s Mahadevapura Zone walked peacefully this morning on Borewell Road in Whitefield, demanding restoration of the road and civic amenities.Citizens marched the 1.5 km stretch from the post office to the Ambedkar statue, while around 200 children and residents stood with placards in solidarity for the cause.Organised by Nallurahalli Rising along with Whitefield Rising, the protest in Hagadur ward drew people Kadugudi, Garadacharpalya and Hoodi wards.Led by a band of drummers and accompanied by a contingent of police, traffic police and traffic wardens, the protesters held placards, wore black and donned masks, to symbolise the pathetic condition of one of Whitefield s oldest roads.The reasons for the protest are many: poor road conditions, garbage strewn roads, fatal accidents due to water tankers that even the police cannot seem to control and all this in Nallurahalli and Whitefield itself.

OBC groups protest delay in granting ST status DIBRUGARH: Expressing displeasure over the delay in granting Scheduled Tribe (ST) status to the state's six OBC communities, members of the All Tai Ahom Students' Union (ATASU) took out a huge protest rally in Dibrugarh town on Friday. Hundreds of protesters marched through the main thoroughfares of the town holding placards and banners before converging in front of the deputy commissioner's office.The protest continued at the site for nearly two hours as the agitating members raised slogans against the Centre and the state government for the delay in according the promised ST status to the six communities - Tai Ahom, Moran, Motok, Chutia, Koch Rajbongshi and Adivasi (tea workers' community of Chotanagpur origin). The protesters dispersed after submitting a memorandum to deputy commissioner Laya Madduri addressed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.Granting of scheduled tribes status to the six communities of the state was a political promise of the BJP. While campaigning in the state in the run-up to the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, Modi himself had spoken about it at public rallies. The promise was reiterated during the state assembly election campaign Modi as well as present chief minister Sarbananda Sonowal. The number of assembly seats reserved for STs is also expected to jump from the existing 16 to about 80 in the 126-member state assembly by fresh delimitation of assembly constituencies.Currently, 102 seats are general seats, 8 are SC reserved seats and 16 are ST reserved seats. A tribal-majority state is seen by many as the only solution to combat the illegal immigration problem from Bangladesh which has hit the state's fragile demography.However, existing ST communities in the state have come out strongly against the move as they fear that the six communities, which are more academically and economically well-off in comparison, will walk away with the advantages of reservations in education and employment sectors if they are accorded ST status.

Demand for Kambala: Hours after protest, Karnataka says will amend†law HOURS after nearly 10,000 people led more than 150 buffaloes in a protest march in Moodbidri area of Dakshina Kannada district in coastal Karnataka on Saturday to demand legalisation of Kambala, a traditional buffalo-racing sport popular in the region, the Karnataka government said it would amend the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act to pave the way for it. While the organisers of the protest on Saturday, under the Dakshina Kannada Kambala Samiti, had intended to hold a Kambala race to defy a November 22, 2016, Karnataka High Court order staying holding of the sport, local authorities dissuaded the organisers against violating the court order.Kambala committees have filed an interim application seeking vacation of the stay; the matter is up for a hearing on January 31. Classical Kannada centre will be retained in Mysuru: CIIL director MYSURU: The row over the shifting of Centre of Excellence for Studies in Classical Kannada from CIIL (Mysuru) to Bengaluru has finally ended with CIIL authorities deciding to retain the centre in Mysuru.A decision to this effect was announced by CIIL (Mysuru) director prof D G Rao during the inauguration of a two-day workshop on ‚ÄòVisioning workshop and project preparation‚Äô being organized by Centre of Excellence for Studies in Classical Kannada (CESCK) at CIIL auditorium from Monday. ‚ÄúThe centre will be retained in Mysuru. It will be temporarily housed in University of Mysore campus, and will be shifted to an independent building later,‚Äù he said.‚ÄúThere are two groups of intellectuals ‚Äî while one wants the centre shifted to Bengaluru, the other wants it retained in Mysuru. Recently, the issue was resolved during Planning and Monitoring Division (PMD) meeting, where it was unanimously decided to retain the centre in Mysuru. For Telugu, the centre was allotted when Andhra Pradesh was united.‚ÄúAs the state has now been split into Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, MHRD will decide where the centre will to be established. For Oriya language, the state government has agreed to allot a space for the centre, and the related work will start soon. Authorities from Kerala government have not approached for a Malayalam language centre. If they approach, we will work out the modalities for that too,‚Äù Rao said.Rao suggested that Kannada centre authorities should invite experts from various branches of Kannada language and sit together to chalk out plans so that the plan can be explained before the ministry and funds can be allotted in the budget.Speaking on the occasion, Central University of Karnataka (Kalaburagi) vice-chancellor H M Maheshwaraiah said that the state government should appoint a liaison officer to chalk out plans and demand funds from the central government for the centre.Maheshwaraiah, who had earlier worked as CESCK director, said: ‚ÄúA roadmap to fill sanctioned non-teaching posts, to translate Kannada literature into English and other regional languages, to start a Kannada journal, to recommend writers who are working for Kannada language and literature in India and abroad for the President of India Award, to digitalize works and to draft an action plan for central funds should be prepared by experts during workshops.‚ÄùKannada Development Authority (KDA) chairman S G Siddaramaiah said that issues pertaining to the classical-language status to Kannada and NEET are clear examples of power politics.‚ÄúIndian Constitution speaks equality of all regional languages. But due to politics, the central government awarded classical status only to Tamil language. But only when other states protested, the status was awarded to Kannada, Telugu and Malayalam. Similarly, students were denied to write in Kannada NEET initially. But after protests, students were allowed to write the test in Kannada. No MP from the state raised their voice on the issue in Parliament. Politics should never interfere in matters regarding languages, water and land,‚Äù he said.Senior Kannada scholar T V Venkatachala Sastry said that all the 15 branches in classical Kannada centre have been grouped under separate units, where small- and medium-term research are taken up. The time frames of research are in the range of three months to three years.

Arunachal's Siang river turns muddy, Centre begins probe GUWAHATI: The centre has confirmed that the Siang River in Arunachal Pradesh has become black and muddy beyond the McMohan Line, the imaginary boundary between India and China, from where the river flows as Yarlong Tsangpo, but the cause is yet to be ascertained.A central government source said that PMO has stepped into the water monitoring process and fresh samples of Siang‚Äôs water and soil from its river bed and banks have been sent to Central Water Commission‚Äôs advanced laboratory in New Delhi test for toxic content. Tests are also being carried out to find presence of bacteria that consume all the dissolved oxygen, leaving nothing for aquatic life to survive following reports of deaths of large number of fish.Union minister of state for home affairs Kiren Rijiju, a native of Arunachal Pradesh, tweeted on Friday, ‚ÄúGovt of India has been continuously tracking & assessing the Siang (Brahmaputra) river flowing pattern from the day one. The concerns of the people are genuine. The cause of water becoming muddy & black beyond McMahon line is being ascertained.‚ÄùReacting to people burning his effigy in Assam, Rijiju in another tweet said, ‚ÄúWhy are some people burning my effigy in Assam? Brahmaputra (Siang) is a sacred river for us. We will inform & make official statement only after getting accurate information of the cause from across the border.‚ÄùThe effects of Siang has spread to Brahmaputra in Assam. The Siang along with other tributaries combine to form the Brahmaputra in Assam. Chief minister Sarbananda Sonowal said, ‚ÄúOur lab tests have found presence of virus and bacteria in Brahmaputra river,‚ÄùThe Chinese state-run daily Global Times last week quoted an environmentalist denying Chinese hand in polluting the Siang, saying the river and Arunachal Pradesh was part of Chinese territory and China could not pollute its own river.The source said that external affairs minister Sushma Swaraj is expected to take up the issue diplomatically when she meets Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi in New Delhi on the sidelines of the 15th Russia, India and China (RIC) Foreign Ministers' meeting on December 11. ‚ÄúThe condition of Siang‚Äôs water is same, black and muddy and there seems to be let-up. Locally the high turbidity has been ascertained but we don‚Äôt want to take any chances and so further tests for toxic content is being done in New Delhi. These tests take time. Tests for biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) are also being done. The amount of dissolved oxygen is vital for aquatic life. BOD levels can go down if there are presence of bacteria that consume the dissolved oxygen, and make it difficult for fish and other aquatic organisms to survive,‚Äù the source said.

Six poachers strike CV Ramana's house, steal 2 sandalwood trees BENGALURU: A gang of six armed poachers stole two sandalwood trees from a Malleswaram house which was once home to Nobel laureate and scientist CV Raman. But then we saw four more men walking in. All of them had their faces covered,‚Äù Gangadhar said.As the duo held Gangadhar and Srinivas at machete-point, the other gang members walked towards the left of the house and began cutting a sandalwood tree with an electric saw.‚ÄúIn less than 20 minutes, they axed two trees and cut them into four logs. One of them ran back to the gate and reversed the Maruti Omni that was parked outside. The van entered the premises and the men transferred the logs to the vehicle. We will collect CCTV footage from the surrounding buildings,‚Äù a senior police officer said, adding, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the handiwork of habitual offenders. We have asked the security guards to explain the miscreants‚Äô physical appearances so that we can match the sketches with the poachers we had arrested earlier,‚Äù police said.Cops said they have submitted the measurements to the forest department to ascertain the exact value of the trees.

Day after BHU violence, 15 current, ex-students booked for rioting, arson A DAY after students of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) went on a rampage on campus protesting the arrest of a member of the BHU unit of the Samajwadi Chhatra Sabha, 15 current and former students, were booked on charges of rioting and arson on Thursday. Tamil Nadu may go ahead with jallikattu by making a law having provisions to address element of cruelty NEW DELHI: The Centre on Thursday expressed its inability to promulgate ordinance over the issue of jallikattu citing the matter being sub-judice, but it assured Tamil Nadu government of its support if state takes any step to hold the banned bull taming sport while adhering to certain dos and don‚Äôts to address the element of cruelty.Assurance of the centre, which has been sympathetic to the state‚Äôs view against the ban on Jallikattu, came during the meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Tamil Nadu chief minister O Paneerselvam here. It is learnt that the Centre would take any step from its side only after the Supreme Court‚Äôs final call on the issue.Tamil Nadu has, however, all rights to make a law allowing Jallikattu as sports is a state subject under Indian constitution. In that case, the state law will have to address the element of cruelty in the sport and impose strict punishment and penalty or both for any violation.‚ÄúWhile appreciating the cultural significance of Jallikattu, the Prime Minister observed that the matter is presently sub-judice. The Centre would be supportive of steps taken by the state government‚Äù, tweeted the PMO after the meeting where the issue of drought in the state was also discussed.Tamil Nadu is learnt to have sought a relief of Rs 39,565 crores for tackling the severe drought in the state following failure of monsoon for two consecutive years.The PMO said, ‚ÄúThe Prime Minister also assured the chief minister that all possible assistance would be provided to the state to address the drought situation, and a central team would be deputed to the state shortly‚Äù.As protests demanding the lifting of the ban on bull taming sport jallikattu spread across Tamil Nadu, Panneerselvam rushed here to meet the Prime Minister with a request for ordinance.‚ÄúWe will soon take steps with the backing of the Centre for the holding of the sport. You will soon see (the steps). All is well that ends well. Wait, good will happen,‚Äù Panneerselvam said after his meeting with the Prime Minister.The chief minister, however, did not elaborate on the next step. Though he was supposed to return to Chennai on Thursday itself, he cancelled his return and held discussions with legal experts. The chief minister is understood to have discussed the option of ordinance and sought opinion whether it could sustain in the face of the Supreme Court being seized of the matter.Speaking about how the impasse can be broken, Attorney General Mukul Rohatgi told a TV news channel that the state can pass its own law.‚ÄúSports falls within the domain of the state, it does not fall within the domain of the Centre. Cruelty to animals falls within the domain of the Centre and that is why there is an act on it. So, if the state is desirous of allowing or promoting this sport, the state must bring out a law, if it so chooses. And the law must concern and take into account all the concerns of cruelty‚Äù, Mukul Rohatgi told the news channel.He said, ‚ÄúIf the state drafted law addresses the issues of cruelty, it will still be challenged in the Supreme Court, but the apex court cannot say that a state cannot have its own law.‚ÄùThe state can, accordingly, go ahead with jallikattu by making appropriate law which may have provisions of addressing the cruelty aspect of the animal sport. Aero India 2017: Govt's approach on defence FDI rational, studying each case, says†Parrikar The government will adopt a rational approach to foreign direct investment in the defence sector keeping in mind the concerns raised by some sections of the Sangh Parivar, defence minister Manohar Parrikar said here on Tuesday. The minister was replying to a question relating to concerns expressed by the Swadeshi Jagaran Manch on the FDI policy in the defence sector in India on the sidelines of the inauguration of the 11th Aero India event.Parrikar said the government would allow 100 per cent FDI only in areas where technologies are non-existent in India. He said that in a family, there is bound to be differences of opinion.We will take concerns into consideration and will not damage any national interest. We are doing it in a rational way after studying each case, the defence minister said. I will welcome 100 per cent FDI in areas where we dont have expertise, he said. Caged parrot CBI comes under attack from Mamata†Banerjee Supreme Court Justice R.M. Pune: SPPU protests over MLA†remark Protesting against the alleged defamation by city MLA Medha Kulkarni, a few university teachers and non-teaching staff staged a protest at the Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) on Thursday. Two days ago, Kulkarni had addressed a press conference questioning the A+ grade given to the SPPU by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) and alleged discrepancy in the varsitys self study report (SSR) submitted for purpose of rating.Taking offence to her allegations, a few varsity teaching and non-teaching staffers and along with Shiv Sena local leader Shyam Deshpande and his party members staged the protest demanding that Kulkarni who is an ex-student of the varsity return her degree.However, hitting back at the protestors, Kulkarni demanded to know why she should return her degree. Are we not allowed to even criticise the wrongdoing of few people in the varsity? I am proud of the university but in recent past, some people are trying to bring its name down, she said.

Padmavati controversy: Alia Bhatt blames violent threats for Nahargarh†death Sanjay Leela Bhansalis magnum opus Padmavati has been facing a lot of trouble since the time of its inception and, on Friday the protests against Bhansalis film took a horrifying turn.The body of a man was found hanging in Rajasthans Nahargarh Fort, 20 km near Jaipur. Bollywood actress Alia Bhatt took to Twitter and expressed her disappointment over the whole incident.This is what happens when violent threats are allowed to made openly without punishment! What is happening? Shocked! noted Bhatt. Alongside the body, slogans were written against the movie scrawled on stones nearby.Many were left shocked by this terrifying incident and even B-Town celebrities felt quite numb by hearing about this accident. A lot of celebrities from Bollywood and other film industries have slammed the string of protests that the team of Padmavati has been facing.The Padmavati row is getting murkier day by day. From the raging protest of some Rajput sections to political parties, the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial is amid controversy owing to its content. Other Bollywood stars including Shraddha Kapoor, Rani Mukherjee, Shefali Shah, Nana Patekar among others have come forward in support of the film. The movie which was slated to release on December 1, 2017 did not get a green light from the Censor Board and hence, for now, has no confirmed release date.

Protests against Padmavati film intensifies in†Rajasthan Protests against Sanjay Leela Bhansalis upcoming movie Padmavati have intensified in Rajasthan with several organisations stating their objection to the movie over Rani Padminis portrayal, while distributors have also decided to wash their hands off it. We dont want to get involved in this controversy; our company has decided to not get involved in this film until this controversy is sorted out, said Raj Bansal, a leading film distributor from Rajasthan. None of my colleagues  there are 3  4 (top) distributors in Rajasthan  and none of them is ready for it. There may still be time to settle the controversy but it keeps on increasing now, to Gujarat, Maharashtra he said.BJP MLA Diya Kumari, of the erstwhile Royal family of Jaipur, issued a statement Tuesday saying that no film should hurt the sentiments of a community by twisting historical facts. The director of the film Padmavati, Sanjay Leela Bhansali should not wrongly depict the story of Queen Padmavati of Chittor. He should get the facts in the film verified by a forum of historians and then release the film.She said, Rajputs will not allow any distortion of the valiant history of Rajasthan and sacrifice of its people in fighting barbarians. If the movie does not display authentic history or takes any liberties, it will not be allowed to be released.Top Rajput body, the Shri Rajput Sabha, also wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi Tuesday and gave an ultimatum of November 12 for a countrywide ban of Padmavati and an FIR against habitual offender Sanjay Leela Bhansali. It said that this type of distortion of history in films like Padmavati will ruin the history and damage the highest values for which our ancestors lived and died.If people see Padmini dancing like stage actor, who will cherish the historical saga of Jauhar, rarest of rare incident of history.there is the glorification of the most barabaric, most devil, most vulgar attacker Alauddin Khilji. As you know, about 16,000 great Rajputanis of Rajasthan dedicated their lives and became martyrs for maintenance of nations prestige, religion, culture and Bharat Mata.Why we allow such glorification of our all-time worst enemy? They have also asked the PM to warn Smriti Irani as she has formally supported for release of film, so that she may be a bit careful in such important matters and withdraw her remarks.On Sunday, Congress spokesperson and Jaipur Congress president Pratap Singh Khachariyawas had said, If the movie distorts history, then it is the responsibility of the Central and state government to ban it. The government is mistaken if it believes that it can screen the movie with distorted history, he said, warning of a law and order situation if the government proceeds with the movie in its current form.A day before him, Union minister of Drinking Water and Sanitation, Uma Bharti, had written an open letter stating, If you are making a historical film, you cannot violate the facts. She said that even to this day, we have respect for Padmavati and hatred for Khilji. She had said that people should find a way to address the apprehensions being raised on the film.Several other organisations, such as Rajput Karni Sena, Shri Rajput Karni Sena, Antarrashtriya Brahman Mahasangh, and others have protested over the movie. The Bajrang Dal also said that it would protest the release of the movie in Rajasthan on November 10. Johar Smriti Sansthan had also called a bandh in Chittorgarh last week against the movie, which is scheduled to release on December 1.

Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi to address rallies in Aligarh, Shamli, Mathura†today Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will address election rallies in Uttar Pradeshs Aligarh, Shamli and Mathura on Monday. With the first phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls barely a week away from commencing, Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi Sunday retorted to Prime Minister Narendra Modis SCAM barb, stating that a person who is involved in scams sees scam everywhere. Modi ji has come up with a new scheme-SCAM. The person who is in involved in scams, sees scams everywhere, Gandhi said while holding a joint rally with Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav in Uttar Pradeshs Kanpur. Replying to Prime Minister Modis SCAM remark, Gandhi spelled out the acronym of SCAM, stating that the Samajwadi Party-Congress alliance abides by it.I will reply to Prime Minister Modis SCAM remark. Its Seva (Service), Bahaduri (Courage), Shamta (Ability) and Modesty, he said. Further taking a jibe at the Prime Minister, the Congress vice-president said people of Uttar Pradesh will make the former realise how the demonetisation had affected them.After the Uttar Pradesh polls, Prime Minister Modi will realise what the people think of demonetisation. People of UP will not buy your lies, he said.The Prime Minister says that he is against corruption. But after demonetisation, there was not a rich man in the queue; no suit boot person was seen. The farmers dont take cheques, they take cash. He has created problems for the poor, he added. He said Prime Minister Modi stopped talking after the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) lost in Bihar and the same will follow in Uttar Pradesh.After his defeat in Bihar, Prime Minister Modi stopped speaking about Bihar; after his Uttar Pradesh defeat he will never speak about Uttar Pradesh again, Rahul said. The people of Uttar Pradesh will be voting for a new government in seven-phase elections between February 11 and March 8. The Congress will be contesting in 105 seats and the Samajwadi Party will be contesting in 298 seats out of the 403 assembly seats.

Cop stoned to death on highway INDORE: A head constable posted at Bori police station was stoned to death by highway robbers near Dodakund village in Alirajpur on Wednesday evening.Arvind Sen, who was recently transferred to Bori, was on his way to meet his family in Jobat, about 30km away. Details are hazy but around 7pm, he seems to have been accosted by a gang of seven to eight looters. They pelted stones at him, causing him to fall off his bike.‚ÄúSen was found lying unconscious, in a pool of blood. He was taken to hospital but was declared brought dead,‚Äù ASP Seema Alawa told TOI. Rocks lay strewn around him.She said that some passersby informed police that they, too, were attacked on the same spot by looters who hurled stones. When a patrol went to investigate, they found Sen. Its possible that the gang was trying to loot passersby and attacked the constable, killing him on the spot. We are investigating all possible angles,ù Alawa said.

Tamil lawyers, students protest against Jallikattu ban in†Delhi The Jallikattu protests Thursday reached Delhi with scores of people including students from Tamil Nadu demonstrating against the ban on the bull-taming sport. The protesters, led by Tamil lawyers in Supreme Court, took out a march from Mandi House to Jantar Mantar raising slogans against People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) and the ban on Jallikattu. Protesters, numbering more than 200, claimed that they dont have any affiliation to any political party or organisation.We dont have any political affiliation. We have gathered here for the protection of Tamil culture and its rich heritage, advocate Mayilsamy, a Supreme Court lawyer, who was among the protesters told PTI. The intention of PETA is to destroy the Tamil culture. They want to eradicate the local breed of cattle and introduce foreign breeds into Indian markets, lawyer Anandaselvam said.Students from various educational institutions in Delhi had also joined the on-going protest against the ban on the bull-taming sport.Jallikattu is our traditional right. We have 50 MPs in Parliament. They were not able to do anything to protect our Jallikattu. We need amendment in the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, Tirupathy, another protester said, adding that they thank the apex court and the PETA for making a local culture world famous.Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu CM O Paneerselvam today met Prime Minister Narendra Modi and sought ordinance for the conduct of Jallikattu. Even though Modi expressed Centres inability to promulgate an ordinance on the issue, Panneerselvam said his government will soon take steps for holding banned Jallikattu event with the backing of the Centre. In Chennai, massive protests in support of Jallikattu continued at the Marina beach and other parts of Tamil Nadu, with hundreds more joining the agitation. Unfazed by the Chief Ministers call to withdraw protests, thousands of volunteers remain steadfast on their demand for holding the bull-taming sport in the state.

SAD, Congress in alliance looted Punjab, says Arvind Kejriwal MAJITHA: AAP national convener and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday alleged that Akali Dal and Congress "in alliance" have "looted" Punjab for decades.Both the parties "in alliance have looted" Punjab for decades and their leaders "have common business interests". With AAP emerging on the political map of Punjab, they fear that "their illegal trades and misdeeds" will be exposed, he alleged while addressing a rally here."This fact has stands approved as neither Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi nor the party's state unit chief Amarinder Singh mentioned the involvement of revenue minister Bikram Singh Majithia in drug trade during their recent rally here," Kejriwal claimed.Majithia is seeking re-election for the third time from Majitha constituency. Congress has fielded Sukhjinder Raj Singh against him while AAP's candidate is Himmat Singh Shergill from this high-profile seat.Majithia and his friends have implicated innocent people, who raised their voices against the oppression, in false cases and Aam Aadmi Party will ensure that these cases are closed and the real culprits behind ruining Punjab are brought to the book," he claimed.Speaking about AAP's zero tolerance towards drugs, Kejriwal claimed, "Everybody knows Majithia and his goons have ruined the youth of the state by patronising drug trade.Majithia and his aides involved in drug trade will be in jail after AAP forms government in Punjab." The Delhi Chief Minister appealed to the people not to let their votes get divided among corrupt parties and help AAP in forming the government and usher Punjab into a new era of prosperity. About on the development works carried out by his party in Delhi, Kejriwal said, "During a short span of time, despite several hurdles laid by the Modi government, AAP has brought a sea change by opening state-of-the-art mohalla clinics and schools of international quality for the public."He exhorted people to vote for Shergill, the AAP candidate from Majitha Assembly constituency and Upkar Singh Sandhu the party nominee for the bypoll in Amritsar Lok Sabha seat.Kejriwal claimed that AAP is the only party that has the vision to restore the glory of Punjab by reviving its industry, agriculture, education and health sectors that have suffered a huge setback due to the "anti-people" policies of SAD-BJP and Congress.
